channel.title: Bad Virus [help/tips needed]
channel.description:
Recently I had someone crack through my firewall, and impliment either, a really bad virus, or good spyware. I have it disconnected from the internet, I just need some help/tips on getting rid of it. After I rebooted, i was able to go into the msconfig, and edit out half of the new programs, that helped out alot. Here are the persisting problems still.
Problems It Gives:[list] [li]no antivirus is allowed to run (blocked by admin?) [/li][li]Cant system restore (blocked by admin?) [list][li]I am the admin, yet cannot do admin things? [/li][li]WWW internet does not work (i suspect blocking me from getting help?)
[ul][li]REGEDIT is not allowed to run (another thing shut off by admin?) [if i could get to run, i could block the programs from being allowed to run][/ul]
The list goes on, but these are the main points that would actually help me on getting rid of it.

item.title: Bad Virus [help/tips needed]
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

CoonHunter:

sorry guys, my computer will not even startup now. i got it free without restore disks, so now to wait for my graduation. i should have enough then. tty guys then. i will be on ebuddy on my mobile though

I dont get the point of infecting people with virus’s for no reason at all.
fags

Read full topic

item.title: Bad Virus [help/tips needed]
item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

What OS you using? try this
Start > Search “Services”
Just to see if they have been stopped.

Read full topic

item.title: Bad Virus [help/tips needed]
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

If you can afford it, get an external hard drive and transfer all of your files that aren’t infected to it and reformat your computer i suppose. Also, see if you can use task manager and find the process that the virus may be running.

Read full topic

item.title: Bad Virus [help/tips needed]
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

Good time for a reformat!

Read full topic

item.title: Bad Virus [help/tips needed]
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

the elve age:

If that doesn’t work(above me ^), I suggest getting professional help, getting someone to get rid of it.

looks like ill hacve to… it wont even startup in safe mode

Read full topic

item.title: Bad Virus [help/tips needed]
item.dc:creator: @HellRain-T HellRain-T
item.description:
@HellRain-T wrote:

Run it in safe mode and delete all the files, if that doesn’t work go to start, programs, accessories, system tools, system restore. Then just choose a date and your computer will go back to how it was on that day.

Read full topic

item.title: Bad Virus [help/tips needed]
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Recently I had someone crack through my firewall, and impliment either, a really bad virus, or good spyware. I have it disconnected from the internet, I just need some help/tips on getting rid of it. After I rebooted, i was able to go into the msconfig, and edit out half of the new programs, that helped out alot. Here are the persisting problems still.

Problems It Gives:[list]
[li]no antivirus is allowed to run (blocked by admin?)
[/li][li]Cant system restore (blocked by admin?)
[list][li]I am the admin, yet cannot do admin things?
[/li][li]WWW internet does not work (i suspect blocking me from getting help?)

[ul][li]REGEDIT is not allowed to run (another thing shut off by admin?) [if i could get to run, i could block the programs from being allowed to run][/ul]

The list goes on, but these are the main points that would actually help me on getting rid of it.
